p:
Furthermore, aqueous and methanolic extracts of 30 Indonesian medicinal plants were tested for antiviral effects against HSV-1 (strain 7401 H) by Nawawi et al.
92 At a concentration of 100 μg/ml, the following extracts inhibited 100% of plaque formation and their IC 50 values were subsequently determined: the methanolic extracts of Eurycoma longifolia (IC 50 = 62 μg/ml), Filicium decipiens (IC 50 = 68 μg/ml), Garcinia mangostana (IC 50 = 40 μg/ml), and Toona sureni (IC 50 = 37 μg/ml); and the aqueous and methanolic extracts of Nephelium lappaceum (IC 50 = 62 μg/ml and 70 μg/ml, respectively) and Punica granatum (IC 50 = 68 μg/ml and 64 μg/ml, respectively). All extracts showed no cytotoxicity at 100 μg/ml except for T. sureni.
